title: BougeRV’s telescopic lantern is ridiculously versatile

title: Judge saves the CFPB, for now
snippets: On Friday, Judge Amy Berman Jackson issued a preliminary injunction to prevent the Trump administration and its Department of Government Efficiency from dismantling the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB) pending the outcome of an ongoing court case.
summary: On Friday, Judge Amy Berman Jackson issued a preliminary injunction that stops the Trump administration and its Department of Government Efficiency from dismantling the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB) until a court case is resolved.

title: Windows 11 is closing a loophole that let you skip making a Microsoft account

summary: Microsoft announced the removal of a bypass script in the latest Windows 11 Insider Preview, which previously enabled users to set up devices without an internet connection or logging into an account.

title: Elon Musk’s xAI buys Elon Musk’s X for $33 billion on paper
snippets: Elon Musk's AI company, xAI, has acquired the social media platform X (previously Twitter) in an all-stock deal. Musk valued xAI at $80 billion and X at $33 billion, which includes $12 billion of debt. This acquisition comes a few years after Musk originally bought Twitter for $44 billion.
summary: Elon Musk's AI firm, xAI, acquired the social media platform X (formerly known as Twitter), in an all-stock transaction. The deal values xAI at $80 billion and X at $33 billion, incorporating $12 billion in debt. This follows Musk's initial purchase of Twitter for $44 billion a few years prior.

title: Microsoft tests Quick Machine Recovery to restore PCs that can’t boot
snippets: Microsoft has begun testing Quick Machine Recovery in its latest Windows Insider Preview build (6120.3653) for Windows 11. This feature aims to enable IT professionals to remotely recover devices that won't boot, a response to prevent incidents similar to the previous year's Crowdstrike catastrophe.
summary: Microsoft is testing a new feature called Quick Machine Recovery in Windows 11's latest Insider Preview build (6120.3653), designed to help IT professionals remotely fix devices that fail to boot. This development is part of efforts to avoid problems like last year's Crowdstrike incident.

title: Global patterns in seed plant distribution over millions of years

summary: A global study of nearly 270,000 seed plant species has found that environmental conditions and dispersal barriers significantly affect plant distribution and diversity.
